name: A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 26
summary: This circular provides clarifications and modifications regarding Foreign Portfolio Investors' (FPI) investments in debt securities. It stipulates that FPI investments in corporate bonds with residual maturity below one year shall not exceed 20% of their total investment in corporate bonds, bringing consistency across debt categories. The circular also provides various clarifications on FPI investments including treasury bills, related FPIs definition, concentration limits, and implementation of online monitoring of G-sec limits.
questions: What is the maximum permitted percentage of investment in securities with residual maturity below one year for FPIs?
When is the implementation date for online monitoring of utilization of G-sec limits?
How is the term 'related FPIs' defined in the circular?
What is the timeline given to FPIs to bring their investments below 20% if they exceed this limit as of May 2, 2018?
Under which sections of the Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999 have these directions been issued?
